verbose_text: Furthermore, for the non stop ultrafast transmitter release events, neural activity selects a specific time window for depression and facilitation of transmitter release; this is mediated by the control of Ca 2+ channel activity with CaM- and neuronal CaS binding, slowing SV replenishment by AZ protein phosphorylation, and activation of myosin IIB or VI XREF_BIBR) in distinct dynamin isoform mediated SV recycling pathways.
evidence: myosin IIB or VI XREF_BIBR ) in distinct dynamin isoform-mediated SV
